title.value: Aspirations and Practice of ML Model Documentation: Moving the Needle with Nudging and Traceability
title.justification: This is the title as mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote:
Aspirations and Practice of ML Model Documentation: Moving
the Needle with Nudging and Traceability

extractions.description: This paper studies the current state of machine-learned (ML) model documentation practices, particularly focusing on the adoption of model cards. It reveals gaps between the proposed documentation practices and real-world applications. Additionally, it introduces a tool named DocML to encourage better documentation practices among data scientists through nudging and traceability features.

type.justification: The paper involves a systematic investigation of existing ML model documentation practices and introduces a new tool based on the findings.
type.quote: In this work, we systematically study ML model documentation in the field and investigate how to encourage more responsible and accountable model documentation practice.

name.justification: The paper addresses the documentation practices and tools supporting the development of ML models, which falls under Software Engineering.
name.quote: The documentation practice for machine-learned (ML) models often falls short of established practices for traditional software, which impedes model accountability and inadvertently abets inappropriate or misuse of models.

name.justification: The focus is specifically on the practices and tools for documenting machine-learned models.
name.quote: Recently, model cards, a proposal for model documentation, have attracted notable attention, but their impact on the actual practice is unclear.

name.justification: The paper involves designing and evaluating a tool to facilitate better documentation practices among data scientists, aligning with themes from HCI.
name.quote:
To this end, we design and implement a documentation tool for
data scientists, named DocML, that supports creating and updating user-oriented documentation during model development in
the computational notebook environment.

name.justification: DocML is the tool introduced and evaluated in the paper to help data scientists create and maintain model documentation.
name.quote: we design and implement a documentation tool for data scientists, named DocML, that supports creating and updating user-oriented documentation during model development in the computational notebook environment.

is_contributed.justification: DocML is a new tool designed and implemented by the authors to support better documentation practices.
is_contributed.quote:
To this end, we design and implement a documentation tool for data scientists, named DocML, that supports creating and updating user-oriented documentation during model development in
the computational notebook environment.

referenced_paper_title.justification: DocML is an original contribution of the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
To this end, we design and implement a documentation tool for data scientists, named DocML, that supports creating and updating user-oriented documentation during model development in
the computational notebook environment.

name.justification: DocML is implemented as an extension for JupyterLab, which is a commonly used notebook environment for data science.
name.quote: DocML is designed and implemented as an extension for JupyterLab, one of the most used notebook environments for data scientists.

referenced_paper_title.justification: JupyterLab is the platform where DocML is integrated, but it is not a focus of any referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: DocML is designed and implemented as an extension for JupyterLab, one of the most used notebook environments for data scientists.
